actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, further defining the manner in which a witness in a Federal court or grand jury proceeding may be ordered to provide information after asserting his privilege against self-incrimination.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Provides that a witness in a Federal court or grand jury proceeding may be ordered to provide information after asserting his privilege against self-incrimination after a review of the underlying facts. Provides that where a United States district judge determines, upon application, that a grant of immunity to a witness would not be in the interest of justice, he may refuse to sign the order granting such immunity.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, further defining the manner in which a witness in a Federal court or grand jury proceeding may be ordered to provide information after asserting his privilege against self-incrimination.
